title: Merge Intervals
description: Given a collection of intervals, merge all overlapping intervals. For example, if intervals [1,3], [2,6], [8,10], and [15,18] are given, the merged intervals would be [1,6], [8,10], and [15,18]. Your task is to implement a function that takes an array of intervals and returns a new array with the merged intervals.
input_format: A list of intervals, where each interval is a pair of integers [start, end].
output_format: A list of merged intervals, where each interval is represented as a pair of integers [start, end].

examples.explanation: Intervals [1,3] and [2,6] overlap, so they are merged to [1,6]. The other intervals do not overlap.
Intervals [1,4] and [4,5] overlap at point 4, and are merged to [1,5].

hints: Sort the intervals based on the start times.
Use a stack to keep track of the merged intervals.

title: Max Area of Island
description: You are given a 2D grid of 0s and 1s, where 0 represents water and 1 represents land. An island is formed by connecting adjacent lands horizontally or vertically. Write a function to return the maximum area of an island in the grid.
input_format: A 2D grid represented as a list of lists containing integers (0s and 1s).
output_format: An integer representing the maximum area of an island.

examples.explanation: The maximum area is from the island formed by the ones in the second row and the third row, which has a total area of 5.
The maximum island area is formed by the ones in the first two rows, totaling an area of 6.

hints: Use Depth-First Search (DFS) to explore the island.
Keep track of the area of each connected component.
Use a set or modify the grid to mark visited positions.
